page.title: 19A walk to Strelley
page.content: On a pleasant summer evening it is very easy to get away from the drab surroundings of our housing estate and take a leisurely stroll to the top of the road, and into Strelley Village. The road through the village has no exit so it seems that time has stood still and the village retains much of the character that it must have had over a hundred years ago.In the centre of the village is the very pleasant Broad Oak public house,called after the magnificent oak tree behind which it stands,this is of course where our stroll is leading.With our drink and packet of crisps we can sit and admire the old cottages and think what it must have been like to have lived here years ago working on the estate belonging to the Edge family.
